_source.text: 163.The palace-garden at Haarlem, formerly occupied by King Louis, and originally the property of the celebrated banker, Hope, is in no respect remarkable as to design; but pines are grown there better than in most gardens in Holland, and strawberries are successfully forced.

text: 163.The palace-garden at Haarlem, formerly occupied by King Louis, and originally the property of the celebrated banker, Hope, is in no **respect** remarkable as to design; but pines are grown there **better** **than** in most gardens in Holland, and strawberries are successfully forced.
